snippet: One day after a fire destroyed the airport’s main arrival hall, full operations were expected to be restored by the end of Thursday, but confusion still reigned at the check-in counters.
abstract: International passenger flights are slowly resuming from Nairobi, Kenya's, main international airport, day after devastating fire ripped through its main arrivals hall and disabled East Africa’s busiest air transportation hub; full operations are expected to be restored by end of day.

byline.original: By REUBEN KYAMA and NICOLA CLARK
byline.contributor: Reuben Kyama reported from Nairobi, and Nicola Clark from Paris.

lead_paragraph: One day after a fire destroyed the airport’s main arrival hall, full operations were expected to be restored by the end of Thursday, but confusion still reigned at the check-in counters.

headline.main: International Flights Are Gradually Resumed at Airport in Nairobi
headline.print_headline: International Flights Are Gradually Resumed at Airport in Nairobi
